_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: All Other Miscellaneous Chemical Product and Preparation Manufacturing
All Other Miscellaneous Chemical Product and Preparation Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
This Risk Management Plan (RMP) has been prepared to meet the requirements of the Risk Management Program Rule.

As part of complying with the Risk Management Program Rule, FloMin Inc. (FloMin) has reviewed and enhanced accidental release procedures and emergency response policies. These policies have been incorporated in the facility's Emergency Response Plan, Plant Safety Manual, Operating Manual, and Utilities Manual.

There are three substances at the FloMin facility that are regulated by the Chemical Accident Prevention Provisions defined at 40 CFR 68.  These substances are used in two processes at the facility to produce chemicals used primarily as reagents in the mining industry.  These substances and the specific process covered include:

*Toxic Substances:

--Carbon disulfide: This material is used in the sodium xanthate (XAN) process. The XAN process uses carbon disulfide as a reactant to produce sodium alkyl xanthate intermediates that are subsequently used in other facility processes to produce collection agents for the mining industry. The maximum quantity of carbon disuldife stored on-site is approximately 320,000 pounds. 

*Flammable Substances:

--Ethylamine: This material is used in the thionocarbamate (TC) process. The TC process uses ethylamine as a reactant to produce collection agents for the mining industry.  The maximum amount of ethylamine stored on-site is approximately 180,000 pounds.

--Methylamine: This material is used in the TC process in similar fashion as ethylamine. The maximum amount of methylamine stored on-site is approximately 88,000 pounds (pure). Methylamine is received and stored as a 40 percent solution in water. 

To address potential accidental releases, an accidental release prevention program along with chemical-specific prevention steps has been developed. 

XAN Process (Carbon disulfide): The XAN Process prevention program includes the following process controls and mitigation systems:

*Vents
*Relief valves
*Check valv

es
*Manual shutoffs
*Automatic shutoffs
*Interlocks
*Alarms and procedures
*Grounding equipment
*Dikes
*Detectors
*Deluge system
*Scrubbers
*Rupture disks
*Purge system

TC Process (Ethylamine and Methylamine): The TC Process prevention program includes the following process controls and mitigation systems:

*Vents
*Relief valves
*Check valves
*Manual shutoffs
*Automatic shutoffs
*Interlocks
*Alarms and procedures
*Grounding equipment
*Deluge system
*Scrubbers
*Rupture disks
*Purge system

Also included in the prevention program for the three substances listed above are the following programs, practices and procedures (as part of the facility's Emergency Response Plan, Plant Safety Manual, Operating Manual, and Utilities Manual):

*Emergency Response
*Emergency Action
*Process Safety Management
*Hurricane and Tropical Storm
*First Responder Team
*Hazard Communication
*Hazardous Waste Management
*Stormwater Pollution Prevention
*Safe Work Practices
*Hazmat/Hazwoper Team
*Operator Training
*Operating procedures

Additionally, the facility has programs to address the OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM) requirements. 

The facility also has an emergency response program (ERP) that has been enhanced as part of implementing the Risk Management Program Rules.  The ERP has been coordinated with the Chambers County LEPC and the Beach City Volunteer Fire Department. Additionally, the Chambers County Sheriff's Department, San Jacinto Methodist Hospital, Baycoast Medical Center, and Mutual Aid Mount Belvieu (MAMB) Organization are part of the Plant Safety Manual.  As part of the community involvement efforts, the following activities are coordinated with some of the agencies listed above:

*Pre-emergency tours
*Emergency action drills
*Community evacuation procedures
*Material safety data sheets
*Responsibility roles in evacuation procedures

Also, the facility has a plant emergency notification system.

As part of preparing the RMP, the facility's five year accident history w

as reviewed.  During the past five years, there have been no RMP reportable accidental releases.

FloMin is committed to continuous improvement of safety.  Planned changes and policies to promote this improvement include continuous review and update of the facility's ERP and various environmental, health, and safety polices, procedures, and practices. These include all the programs and plans listed above in the prevention programs as well as safety incentive programs to promote employee safety and community awareness programs.
